turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lepidosauromorpha.
turn.1: What are the different species of Lepidosauromorpha?
turn.2: Lepidosauromorpha Lepidosauromorpha is a group of reptiles comprising all diapsids closer to lizards than to archosaurs (which include crocodiles and birds).
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The only living sub-group is the Lepidosauria: extant lizards, snakes, amphisbaenians and tuataras.
turn.5: How are they similar to each other?
turn.6: Lepidosauromorpha are distinguishable from Archosauromorphs (archosaurs) by their primitive sprawling gait, which allows for the same sinusoidal trunk and tail movement seen in fish, the sliding "joint" between the coracoids and the sternum (for a longer stride), and their pleurodont dentition.
turn.8: In contrast, Archosauromorphs possess a parasagittal gait, a reduction in their dermal girdle, a reduction and/or loss of the sternum, and a more thecodont dentition.
turn.9: In what other ways do they differ?
turn.10: Lepidosauromorpha have retained cold blood because of their low-energy sprawling stance.
